/ERC20Basic.sol":{"keccak256":"0x516a17244073b518096ced7c8c94924cb29746ef0a4b6cc6cde125ac0406a419","urls":["bzzr://7addb1b5cad767651b9bcd688ba5b08769c1f3b70a470e34752a7717756d090d"]},"/Users/perlets/Documents/projects/ERC-2980-implementation/node_modules/openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/token/ERC20/MintableToken.sol":{"keccak256":"0x08394b7d7e6327085c15e8b7652cc9f4f9ddf3a9c614d9c8c3a3cff04fb781bf","urls":["bzzr://a0d8fca9e3eb8900f618afce5012ba48c4c664ebb6bf8ac7536367120c43fde7"]},"/Users/perlets/Documents/projects/ERC-2980-implementation/node_modules/openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/token/ERC20/StandardToken.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf98b4a9eed5064ef6fa47c3250121cf03f4f6528a20706d7b99e6c1dc9c1bb98","urls":["bzzr://7979b5eadacec799f6337581fdecb2f925ffb0f320fda4402bda043af1cbe706"]}},"version":1}

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: caller is not the owner"

arguments.value: Ownable: caller is not the owner

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: caller is not the owner"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: caller is not the owner"

arguments.value: Ownable: caller is not the owner

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Ownable: caller is not the owner"

addAddressToFrozenlist(address).details: add an address to the frozenlist
addAddressToFrozenlist(address).return: true if the address was added to the frozenlist, false if the address was already in the frozenlist

addAddressToWhitelist(address).details: add an address to the whitelist
addAddressToWhitelist(address).return: true if the address was added to the whitelist, false if the address was already in the whitelist

addAddressesToFrozenlist(address[]).return: true if at least one address was added to the frozenlist, false if all addresses were already in the frozenlist

addAddressesToWhitelist(address[]).return: true if at least one address was added to the whitelist, false if all addresses were already in the whitelist

addIssuer(address).return: true if the address was not an issuer, false if the address was already an issuer

allowance(address,address).details: Function to check the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.

params._owner: address The address which owns the funds.
params._spender: address The address which will spend the funds.

allowance(address,address).return: A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender.

approve(address,uint256).details: Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender. Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

params._spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params._value: The amount of tokens to be spent.

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address.

params._owner: The address to query the the balance of.

balanceOf(address).return: An uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address.

checkRole(address,string).details: reverts if addr does not have role

params._role: the name of the role // reverts

decreaseApproval(address,uint256).details: Decrease the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender. approve should be called when allowed[_spender] == 0. To decrement allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol

params._spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params._subtractedValue: The amount of tokens to decrease the allowance by.

finishMinting().details: Function to stop minting new tokens.
finishMinting().return: True if the operation was successful.

frozenlist(address).details: getter to determine if address is in frozenlist

increaseApproval(address,uint256).details: Increase the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender. approve should be called when allowed[_spender] == 0. To increment allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol

params._addedValue: The amount of tokens to increase the allowance by.
params._spender: The address which will spend the funds.

isIssuer(address).details: getter to determine if address has issuer role

removeAddressFromFrozenlist(address).details: remove an address from the frozenlist
removeAddressFromFrozenlist(address).return: true if the address was removed from the frozenlist, false if the address wasn't in the frozenlist in the first place

removeAddressFromWhitelist(address).details: remove an address from the whitelist
removeAddressFromWhitelist(address).return: true if the address was removed from the whitelist, false if the address wasn't in the whitelist in the first place

removeAddressesFromFrozenlist(address[]).return: true if at least one address was removed from the frozenlist, false if all addresses weren't in the frozenlist in the first place

removeAddressesFromWhitelist(address[]).return: true if at least one address was removed from the whitelist, false if all addresses weren't in the whitelist in the first place

removeIssuer(address).return: true if the address has been removed from issuers, false if the address wasn't in the issuer list in the first place

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.

totalSupply().details: Total number of tokens in existence

transferIssuer(address).details: Allows the current issuer to transfer his role to a newIssuer.

params._newIssuer: The address to transfer the issuer role to.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params._newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

whitelist(address).details: getter to determine if address is in whitelist

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.
